intro: Draba greggioides, commonly known as the Sierra draba, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. It produces basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer. Draba greggioides is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high elevations where few other plants can survive.
